content: 🐊 alec the alligator 🐊 knitting pattern by amanda berry email fluffandfuzz@googlemail com ╳ website fluffandfuzz@weebly com yarn - the alligator is knitted in up to 25g of green yarn plus a few metres of white yarn to embroider the teeth - the toy photographed was knitted in 100% acrylic 4 ply yarns that have since been discontinued a recommended substitute is stylecraft special 4 ply 100% acrylic - dk yarns double knitting/light worsted weight/8 ply yarns could also be used such as stylecraft special dk and paintbox yarns simply dk both of which are 100% acrylic needles & notions - a pair of 3 25mm us 3 single pointed needles minimum length 20cm - a darning or tapestry needle for seaming - a few handfuls of toy filling - two 6mm toy safety eyes - stitch markers copyright © 2018 amanda berry this free pattern is for personal use only not for resale all patterns designed by amanda berry are protected by international copyright laws any unauthorised copying sharing or reselling will constitute an infringement of copyright all rights reserved i encourage and permit the sharing of this pattern to raise funds for good causes and charities however reselling this pattern is not permitted alec the alligator copyright © 2018 amanda berry page 1 of 3 notes knitting pattern introduction snap snap alec is a pocket sized alligator body alligator so you can carry them with you on your make 1 start at the tip of the tail cast on 5 sts in adventures green on 3 25mm needles work flat all pieces are worked flat back and row 1 ws purl forth on the single pointed knitting needles not in row 2 rs k1 kfb k1 2 times 7 sts the round row 3 p2 k3 p2 casting on use the long tail cast on row 4 knit pull through to cast off cut the yarn leaving at least a 30cm tail thread the tail onto a darning row 5 p2 k3 p2 needle and sew through the sts on the knitting row 6 k1 kfb kfb k1 kfb kfb k1 11 sts needle pull the sts off the knitting needle onto the row 7 p3 k5 p3 yarn gather together tightly and secure the yarn row 8 knit one size 19cm long row 9 to 10 repeat row 7 and 8 gauge 28 sts x 36 row for a 10cm x 10cm square in stockinette stitch on 3 25mm needles don t row 11 p3 k5 p3 worry about gauge for this pattern it is not critical row 12 k2 kfb kfb k3 kfb kfb k2 15 sts row 13 p4 k7 p4 abbreviations row 14 knit foll following row 15 to 16 repeat row 13 and 14 k knit row 17 p4 k7 p4 k2tog knit two stitches together decrease by 1 row 18 k3 kfb kfb k5 kfb kfb k3 19 sts kfb knit into front and back increase by 1 row 19 p5 k9
